text:
Raskolnikov stopped at each landing, curiosity pulsing through him. 

He paused on the first landing. The window framework was gone. 

“Not like this before,” he thought. 

On the second floor, he saw the flat was shut and newly painted. 

He moved to the third and fourth floors. 

“Here!” 

The door stood wide open. Voices echoed inside. 

He hesitated, then climbed the last stairs. 

Inside, workmen bustled about. 

Bare walls stared back at him. 

He sat on the window-sill, feeling oddly out of place. 

Two young workmen papered the walls with lilac flowers. 

He frowned at the change. 

“Why are you preening?” the elder asked the younger. 

“I’m ready to do anything to please you, Tit Vassilitch!” 

Raskolnikov listened, feeling a strange annoyance.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is disturbed to find the flat he once knew being renovated and occupied by workmen, contrasting his memories of the past.
